result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin A Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: any sentence currently serving and to Case 14CF117, if revoked.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Costs and DNA Surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per Agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with any Walmart.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Justin A Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern and Abbie Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's parents spoke on his behalf. 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS 6 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 0 days), consecutive to sentence currently serving and to 14CF117 if revoked.
  -  1 YEAR 6 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S); consecutive to sentence currently serving and to 14CF117.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  any Walmart
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per agent.

COURT COSTS:  $278 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:   90 DAYS - STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion, agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Dated March 25, 2014 filed by Attorney Fragoso, copy of relevant portinos of defendant's revocation packet requested by the court.

Sentencing hearing on April 1, 2014 at 10:45 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Justin A Brown in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R. Fragoso.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Penalty enhancer struck by Court upon motion of the State.
The court sets the matter over for Attorney Fragoso to file the revocation order and warrant from the defendant's case in which he is now serving a sentence.  
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT REMAIN AT THE WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL UNTIL THE NEXT COURT DATE OF APRIL 1, 2014.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 10:45 am.
